means: 认为…是
把…归于
把…品质归于某人
认为某事[物]属于某人[物]
属性
（人或物的）特征
价值
[语法学]定语

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均有"把……归于"之意。
means: attribute ：指出于相信而把……归于某人或某物，含较多的客观性。
ascribe ：指根据推论或猜想把……归于某人或某物，含主观臆断成分较重。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"特性，特点，品质"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: quality, property, feature, characteristic, peculiarity, trait, attribute, character
means: quality ： 最普通用词，既可指有形或无形的特性，又可指个性或共性的特征。
property ： 多指同类事物所共有的特性，一般不用于指人。
feature ： 指事物突出引人注目的特点。多用来说明人的容貌特征或地理特征。
characteristic ： 指某人或某物天生有别于他人或他物的内部特质或外表特征。
peculiarity ： 指人或事物独具的或奇怪的特点，常带感情色彩。
trait ： 多指人的性格、心情的特征，尤指先天秉赋的持久的行为模式或性格特征。
attribute ： 通常指人主观赋予某事物的属性，可指典型事物。
character ： 多指一类人或事物所具有的独特的典型的特征。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"标志，象征，符号"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: symbol, badge, sign, signal, mark, token, attribute, emblem
means: symbol ： 指作象征或表达某种深邃意蕴的特殊事物。
badge ： 一般指金属证章或写有姓名的带状标志物。
sign ： 普通用词，指人们公认事物的记号，也可指某种情况的征兆。
signal ： 指为某一目的而有意发出的信号。
mark ： 普通用词，含义广泛。既可指方便于辨认而有意做的标记，又可指自然形成的标记或有别于他事物的特征。
token ： 语气庄重，指礼品、纪念物等作为表示友谊、爱情等的象征或标志。
attribute ： 指人或物及其地位、属性的象征。
emblem ： 指选定象征一个国家、民族或家庭等的图案或实物。

sentence.Network_en: People were beginning to attribute superhuman qualities to him.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们开始觉得他超人一等。

sentence.Network_en: Childhood had less freedom and joy than we sentimentally attribute to it.
sentence.Network_cn: 童年并非像我们现在一厢情愿所认为的那样自在快乐。

sentence.Network_en: Cruelty is a normal attribute of human behaviour.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: the noun from Old French attribut; the verb from Latin attribut- 'allotted': both from the verb attribuere, from ad- 'to' + tribuere 'assign'

entry.def: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation.

example.ex: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
example.tran: 女性倾向于将她们的成功归因于外部因素，比如运气。

entry.tran: 将（品质或特征）加于…;认为…为…所有
entry.def: If you attribute a particular quality or feature to someone or something, you think that they have got it.

example.ex: People were beginning to attribute superhuman qualities to him.
example.tran: 人们开始觉得他超人一等。

entry.tran: 认为(文章、艺术品或评论）出自…
entry.def: If a piece of writing, a work of art, or a remark is attributed to someone, people say that they wrote it, created it, or said it.

example.ex: This, and the remaining frescoes, are not attributed to Giotto.
example.tran: 这个，还有那些残存的湿壁画，都不是乔托的作品。

example.ex: ...a Madonna and Child attributed to Pietro Lorenzetti.
example.tran: 被认为出自彼得罗·洛伦泽蒂之手的作品《圣母子》

entry.def: An attribute is a quality or feature that someone or something has.

example.ex: Cruelty is a normal attribute of human behaviour...
He has every attribute you could want and could play for any team.
example.tran: 他具备你想要的所有品质，放在哪个队都行。

means.word_mean: 1. a construct whereby objects or individuals can be distinguished;
2. an abstraction belonging to or characteristic of an entity
2. decide as to where something belongs in a scheme;

sentences.sentence: "The biologist assigned the mushroom to the proper class"

auth_sentence.content: I'm...inclined to attribute other feelings to my overheated imagination.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm...inclined to attribute other feelings to my overheated imagination.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm...inclined to attribute other feelings to my overheated imagination.

auth_sentence.content: I'd definitely not attribute spiritual faith to biology.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'd definitely not attribute spiritual faith to biology.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'd definitely not attribute spiritual faith to biology.

auth_sentence.content: Her best attribute may be her undeniable work ethic.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her best attribute may be her undeniable work ethic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her best attribute may be her undeniable work ethic.

stems_affixes.word_buile: contributor[n.捐款人,贡献者,投稿者]+y……的→adj.贡献的, 捐助的
tribut给予+ary表形容词或名词→给予东西→进贡的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 贡品;颂词,称赞,[表示敬意的]礼物
stems_affixes.word_buile: tribut给予+e→n.贡品;颂词,称赞,[表示敬意的]礼物
at加强动作+tribut给予+e→[把原因]给出→归因于
attribute[v.[to]归因于,归属于 n.属性,品质,特征]+ion表名词→n.归因

stems_affixes.value_cn: 捐献, 贡献, 投稿
stems_affixes.word_buile: contribute[v.[to]贡献,捐助,捐献;投稿]+ion表名词→contribution捐献, 贡献
contribute[v.[to]贡献,捐助,捐献;投稿]+or人→n.捐款人,贡献者,投稿者
distribute[v.分发;分配;分布;配[电];[over]散布]+ion表名词→n.分发,分配;分布
re回+tribut给予+ion表名词→给回去→报复,报酬
at加强动作+tribut给予+e→[把原因]给出→归因于
con全部+tribut给予+e→全部给出→捐钱

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分发;分配;分布;配[电];[over]散布

Sentence.sentence: Although many attribute Kodak's downfall to "complacency(自满) ," that explanation doesn't acknowledge the lengths to which the company went to reinvent itself.
"If you ask Japanese students to list the positive attributes they expect in a romantic partner, they rate highly things like loyalty, commitment and devotion," says O'Sullivan.

sentences.en: He attributes his success to working hard.
sentences.cn: 他认为他的成功是艰苦工作的结果。

means.word_mean: 认为某作品出自某人之手

sentences.en: We attributed this saying to Shakespeare.
sentences.cn: 我们认为这句格言出自莎士比亚。

means.word_mean: 认为某事[物]属于某人[物]

sentences.en: Some scientists attribute intelligence to ants.
sentences.cn: 有些科学家认为蚂蚁有智力。

means.word_mean: 把…归于；把…归因于，把…归咎于，把(过错的责任等)归于，诿于(to)

sentences.en: They attributed Edison’s success to intelligence and hard work.
sentences.cn: 他们把爱迪生的成功归因于他的智力和刻苦工作。

means.word_mean: 把…品质归于某人，认为某人具有…品性，认为(品性、特征)属于…

sentences.en: She attributed intelligence to her colleagues.
sentences.cn: 她认为她的同事们很聪明。

sentences.en: Kindness is one of his best attributes.
sentences.cn: 仁慈是他的好品性之一。

jushi.english: They appeared to possess all the attributes of a ruling class.
jushi.chinese: 他们似乎具有统治阶级的一切特征。

jushi.english: Kindness is one of his best attributes.
jushi.chinese: 仁慈是他的好品性之一。

jushi.english: It is surprising how soon historical personages became invested with romantic attributes.
jushi.chinese: 令人惊奇的是历史人物很快就带有传奇的色彩。
